content.webTitle: Senate listens in on Russian hacking

fields.headline: Senate listens in on Russian hacking
fields.bodyText: The departing head of US intelligence defended analysts against attacks by Donald Trump, following their conclusion that Russia interfered in the president election. Clapper hits back Neither Clapper nor Admiral Michael Rogers, director of the National Security Agency, offered new evidence for their conclusion. Clapper promised to release an unclassified report with additional information early next week. Trump will name the former Indiana senator and Senate intelligence committee member as his director of national intelligence, it was reported on Thursday. The pick could be announced later this week. More about Coats. Senate Democrats have called for an investigation into whether Georgia congressman Tom Price, Trump’s nominee for health secretary, broke laws regarding insider trading. ‘We’re an accountability Congress’ In a tweet, Trump said Toyota would face a “big border tax” if it didn’t build cars meant for the US within the states. The tweet was his latest attack on a car manufacturer, in this case a non-American one. “NO WAY!” The legislation to defund would be part of the attempt to repeal the Affordable Care Act. Another attempt
